series.title: Mayflower Trilogy
series.description:
Orson Scott Card and Kathryn H. Kidd bring us this science fiction saga of space exploration--and of a dramatic conflict between human and non-human intelligence. Lovelock is a capuchin monkey engineered to be the perfect servant: intelligent, agile, and devoted to his owner. He is a Witness, privileged to spend his days and nights recording the life of one of Earth's most brilliant scientists via digital devices implanted behind his eyes.
    
    But Lovelock is something special among Witnesses. He's a little smarter than most humans; smart enough to break through some of his conditioning. Smart enough to feel the bonds of slavery--and want freedom. 
    
    http://us.macmillan.com/series/MayflowerTrilogy

series.title: Pastwatch
series.description:
In this thought-provoking series of time travel from science fiction master Orson Scott Card, a group of scientists watches the past through a machine, seeking an answer that will save the world. War, plague, drought and famine have reduced humanity to a population of one billion. When a talented researcher discovers a possibility that might alter the course of history, questions arise: Can the past be changed? And even if it will save the world, can it be right to wipe out a timeline of hundreds of years? 
    
    http://us.macmillan.com/series/Pastwatch

series.title: Mither Mages
series.description:
Danny North's family is different, and he is different from them. His cousins have long been able to create fairies, ghosts, golems, trolls, werewolves, and other such miracles, but Danny has yet to find his talent. He's beginning to think he's a drekka--a mage with no magical ability. But when Danny finally discovers his gift, it is greater than he ever imagined--but that could earn him a death sentence.
    
    So begins this contemporary fantasy saga from Orson Scott Card, award-winning author of Ender's Game.
    
    http://us.macmillan.com/series/MitherMages
    
    The series is designed to be read in order (1-3), as each one is a continuation of the story.
    
    However, Stonefather (shown as #.5) is a little bit of a prequel and describes the worlds and magic system, but does not about any of the characters in the trilogy. This book can be read in any order.
    
    Gatefather (Book #3) will be available September 22, 2015.
series.note: Sandmagic both standalone and in anthology.

series.title: The Ender Quintet
series.description: The Ender's Game series (sometimes called Enderverse or the Ender series) is a series of science fiction books by Orson Scott Card. The series started with the novelette "Ender's Game", which was later expanded into the novel Ender's Game. It currently consists of eleven novels and ten short stories. The first two novels in the series, Ender's Game and Speaker for the Dead, each won both the Hugo and Nebula Awards, and were among the most influential science fiction novels of the 1980s. Also See Ender's Shadow parallel series and The First Formic War prequel series. For the entire Ender's Universe in Chronological Order, see The Enderverse (Chronological Order). First Meetings in Ender's Universe is a collection of 3 Short Stories, and the original Ender's Game Novella. The two short stories titles Polish Boy and Teacher's Pest are prequels to the entire Ender's Saga. The short story Investment Counselor takes place between Ender in Exile and Speaker for the Dead. A War of Gifts is a short story that takes place during Ender's Game, sometime during the middle of the book. Ender in Exile replaces the last chapter of Ender's Game and expands it into its own novel. It also occurs consecutively with The Shadow Saga, a side-series that occurs before Speaker for the Dead. For the series in publication order, see: Ender's Saga (Publication Order). For other short stories of the Ender's universe, see Ender's Saga short stories.
series.note: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ender%27s_Game_series The Ender Quintet is the actual name of the series, popularly known as "Ender's Saga". Librarians Note: First Meetings in Ender's Universe is a collection of 3 Short Stories, and the original Ender's Game Novella. The two short stories titles Polish Boy and Teacher's Pest are prequels to the entire Ender's Saga. The short story Investment Counselor takes place between Ender in Exile and Speaker for the Dead. A War of Gifts is a short story that takes place during Ender's Game, sometime during the middle of the book. Ender in Exile replaces the last chapter of Ender's Game and expands it into its own novel. It also occurs consecutively with The Shadow Saga, a side-series that occurs before Speaker for the Dead. Shadows in Flight takes place during the books Speaker for the Dead, Xenocide, and Children of the Mind. Shadows Alive, the last, and as-of-yet unwritten, book in the Shadow Saga is a book that occurs after the conclusion of Children of the Mind For the series in publication order, see: Ender's Saga (Publication Order). For other short stories of the Ender's universe, see Ender's Saga short stories.

best_book.title: First Meetings in Ender's Universe (The Ender Quintet, #0.5)

series.title: Tales of Alvin Maker
series.description: From the author of Ender’s Game, an unforgettable fantasy tale about young Alvin Maker. In this alternative history of frontier America, folk magic actually works—dowsers find water and second sight warns of true dangers—and that magic has colored the entire history of the colonies. Alvin, the seventh son of a seventh son, is a Maker, the first to be born in a century. He must learn to use his gift wisely. But dark forces are arrayed against Alvin, and only a young girl with second sight can protect him. http://us.macmillan.com/series/AlvinMaker For novellas set in Alvin Maker's world, see Legends ("The Grinning Man"), and Legends II ("The Yazoo Queen"). There is also a graphic novel series based on these books, entitled Red Prophet: The Tales of Alvin Maker.

series.title: Homecoming Saga
series.description:
In this science fiction epic from Orson Scott Card, it is 40 million years in the future, and humanity long ago abandoned Earth, rendered uninhabitable by their destructive wars. Now, mankind survives on the planet of Harmony, where the Oversoul--an artificial intelligence--protects them from their own worst impulses. There are no wars, no dangerous technologies or weapons of mass destruction.
    
    But after so many millennia, the Oversoul is beginning to fail. Now, a group of humans must return to Earth and seek advice from the entity on which the Oversoul is modeled--the mysterious Keeper of the Earth.
    
    http://us.macmillan.com/series/HomecomingSaga

series.title: Ender's Shadow
series.description: This series is a companion-series to The Ender Quintet told from the perspective of other key characters. Ender's Shadow takes place consecutively with Ender's Game. Shadow of the Hegemon, Shadow Puppets, and Shadow of the Giant all take place consecutively with Ender in Exile. Shadows in Flight takes place consecutively with Speaker for the Dead, Xenocide, and Children of the Mind. Shadows Alive takes place after the Ender Quintet series. http://us.macmillan.com/series/TheShadowSeries
series.note: Added links to the Ender Quintet "The Shadow Series" is the series as listed in Amazon. However, Ender's Shadow is the most common series title listed on most websites. Either way, "Shadow Saga" was incorrect. Another librarian had stated that "Series" should not be in series title due to goodreads title convention, but the librarian manual does not state this. However, with this in mind, and because it is a part of the Ender World, I have updated the series to the most commonly recognized "Ender's Shadow".

series.title: The Enderverse
series.description: Chronological Order This contains all the books in the universe of Ender's Game, to include The Ender Quintet, The Shadow Saga, and The First Formic War. For the best order to read the books in, follow this list Starting at First Meetings through Shadows Alive, then read the prequel trilogy.
series.note: Chronological Order)

series.title: Enderverse:  Publication Order
series.description: This series listing gives the Ender books in publication order. For the books in chronological order, see The Ender Quintet (which will also give more complete information about the series) and The Shadow Series. For other short stories of the Ender's universe, see Ender's Saga short stories Note: Omnibuses/box sets are not included in this listing.
series.note: The Ender Quintet is the official series title. I updated the title accordingly. Ender's Saga is a popular term but is not accurate. The Shadow Series is official where Shadow Saga is not... someone else had mentioned that "Series" should not be in series title due to goodreads rules, but the librarian manual does not state this. However, with this in mind, the series most commonly recognized across the web is "Ender's Shadow" series. So it was updated accordingly.

series.title: Mither Mages
series.description:
Danny North's family is different, and he is different from them. His cousins have long been able to create fairies, ghosts, golems, trolls, werewolves, and other such miracles, but Danny has yet to find his talent. He's beginning to think he's a drekka--a mage with no magical ability. But when Danny finally discovers his gift, it is greater than he ever imagined--but that could earn him a death sentence.
    
    So begins this contemporary fantasy saga from Orson Scott Card, award-winning author of Ender's Game.
    
    http://us.macmillan.com/series/MitherMages
    
    The series is designed to be read in order (1-3), as each one is a continuation of the story.
    
    However, Stonefather (shown as #.5) is a little bit of a prequel and describes the worlds and magic system, but does not about any of the characters in the trilogy. This book can be read in any order.
    
    Gatefather (Book #3) will be available September 22, 2015.
series.note: Sandmagic both standalone and in anthology.

series.title: Tales of Alvin Maker
series.description: From the author of Ender’s Game, an unforgettable fantasy tale about young Alvin Maker. In this alternative history of frontier America, folk magic actually works—dowsers find water and second sight warns of true dangers—and that magic has colored the entire history of the colonies. Alvin, the seventh son of a seventh son, is a Maker, the first to be born in a century. He must learn to use his gift wisely. But dark forces are arrayed against Alvin, and only a young girl with second sight can protect him. http://us.macmillan.com/series/AlvinMaker For novellas set in Alvin Maker's world, see Legends ("The Grinning Man"), and Legends II ("The Yazoo Queen"). There is also a graphic novel series based on these books, entitled Red Prophet: The Tales of Alvin Maker.

series.title: Homecoming Saga
series.description:
In this science fiction epic from Orson Scott Card, it is 40 million years in the future, and humanity long ago abandoned Earth, rendered uninhabitable by their destructive wars. Now, mankind survives on the planet of Harmony, where the Oversoul--an artificial intelligence--protects them from their own worst impulses. There are no wars, no dangerous technologies or weapons of mass destruction.
    
    But after so many millennia, the Oversoul is beginning to fail. Now, a group of humans must return to Earth and seek advice from the entity on which the Oversoul is modeled--the mysterious Keeper of the Earth.
    
    http://us.macmillan.com/series/HomecomingSaga

series.title: The Ender Quintet
series.description: The Ender's Game series (sometimes called Enderverse or the Ender series) is a series of science fiction books by Orson Scott Card. The series started with the novelette "Ender's Game", which was later expanded into the novel Ender's Game. It currently consists of eleven novels and ten short stories. The first two novels in the series, Ender's Game and Speaker for the Dead, each won both the Hugo and Nebula Awards, and were among the most influential science fiction novels of the 1980s. Also See Ender's Shadow parallel series and The First Formic War prequel series. For the entire Ender's Universe in Chronological Order, see The Enderverse (Chronological Order). First Meetings in Ender's Universe is a collection of 3 Short Stories, and the original Ender's Game Novella. The two short stories titles Polish Boy and Teacher's Pest are prequels to the entire Ender's Saga. The short story Investment Counselor takes place between Ender in Exile and Speaker for the Dead. A War of Gifts is a short story that takes place during Ender's Game, sometime during the middle of the book. Ender in Exile replaces the last chapter of Ender's Game and expands it into its own novel. It also occurs consecutively with The Shadow Saga, a side-series that occurs before Speaker for the Dead. For the series in publication order, see: Ender's Saga (Publication Order). For other short stories of the Ender's universe, see Ender's Saga short stories.
series.note: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ender%27s_Game_series The Ender Quintet is the actual name of the series, popularly known as "Ender's Saga". Librarians Note: First Meetings in Ender's Universe is a collection of 3 Short Stories, and the original Ender's Game Novella. The two short stories titles Polish Boy and Teacher's Pest are prequels to the entire Ender's Saga. The short story Investment Counselor takes place between Ender in Exile and Speaker for the Dead. A War of Gifts is a short story that takes place during Ender's Game, sometime during the middle of the book. Ender in Exile replaces the last chapter of Ender's Game and expands it into its own novel. It also occurs consecutively with The Shadow Saga, a side-series that occurs before Speaker for the Dead. Shadows in Flight takes place during the books Speaker for the Dead, Xenocide, and Children of the Mind. Shadows Alive, the last, and as-of-yet unwritten, book in the Shadow Saga is a book that occurs after the conclusion of Children of the Mind For the series in publication order, see: Ender's Saga (Publication Order). For other short stories of the Ender's universe, see Ender's Saga short stories.

series.title: The Ender Quintet
series.description: The Ender's Game series (sometimes called Enderverse or the Ender series) is a series of science fiction books by Orson Scott Card. The series started with the novelette "Ender's Game", which was later expanded into the novel Ender's Game. It currently consists of eleven novels and ten short stories. The first two novels in the series, Ender's Game and Speaker for the Dead, each won both the Hugo and Nebula Awards, and were among the most influential science fiction novels of the 1980s. Also See Ender's Shadow parallel series and The First Formic War prequel series. For the entire Ender's Universe in Chronological Order, see The Enderverse (Chronological Order). First Meetings in Ender's Universe is a collection of 3 Short Stories, and the original Ender's Game Novella. The two short stories titles Polish Boy and Teacher's Pest are prequels to the entire Ender's Saga. The short story Investment Counselor takes place between Ender in Exile and Speaker for the Dead. A War of Gifts is a short story that takes place during Ender's Game, sometime during the middle of the book. Ender in Exile replaces the last chapter of Ender's Game and expands it into its own novel. It also occurs consecutively with The Shadow Saga, a side-series that occurs before Speaker for the Dead. For the series in publication order, see: Ender's Saga (Publication Order). For other short stories of the Ender's universe, see Ender's Saga short stories.
series.note: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ender%27s_Game_series The Ender Quintet is the actual name of the series, popularly known as "Ender's Saga". Librarians Note: First Meetings in Ender's Universe is a collection of 3 Short Stories, and the original Ender's Game Novella. The two short stories titles Polish Boy and Teacher's Pest are prequels to the entire Ender's Saga. The short story Investment Counselor takes place between Ender in Exile and Speaker for the Dead. A War of Gifts is a short story that takes place during Ender's Game, sometime during the middle of the book. Ender in Exile replaces the last chapter of Ender's Game and expands it into its own novel. It also occurs consecutively with The Shadow Saga, a side-series that occurs before Speaker for the Dead. Shadows in Flight takes place during the books Speaker for the Dead, Xenocide, and Children of the Mind. Shadows Alive, the last, and as-of-yet unwritten, book in the Shadow Saga is a book that occurs after the conclusion of Children of the Mind For the series in publication order, see: Ender's Saga (Publication Order). For other short stories of the Ender's universe, see Ender's Saga short stories.

best_book.title: Children of the Mind (The Ender Quintet, #5)

series.title: Tales of Alvin Maker
series.description: From the author of Ender’s Game, an unforgettable fantasy tale about young Alvin Maker. In this alternative history of frontier America, folk magic actually works—dowsers find water and second sight warns of true dangers—and that magic has colored the entire history of the colonies. Alvin, the seventh son of a seventh son, is a Maker, the first to be born in a century. He must learn to use his gift wisely. But dark forces are arrayed against Alvin, and only a young girl with second sight can protect him. http://us.macmillan.com/series/AlvinMaker For novellas set in Alvin Maker's world, see Legends ("The Grinning Man"), and Legends II ("The Yazoo Queen"). There is also a graphic novel series based on these books, entitled Red Prophet: The Tales of Alvin Maker.

series.title: Homecoming Saga
series.description:
In this science fiction epic from Orson Scott Card, it is 40 million years in the future, and humanity long ago abandoned Earth, rendered uninhabitable by their destructive wars. Now, mankind survives on the planet of Harmony, where the Oversoul--an artificial intelligence--protects them from their own worst impulses. There are no wars, no dangerous technologies or weapons of mass destruction.
    
    But after so many millennia, the Oversoul is beginning to fail. Now, a group of humans must return to Earth and seek advice from the entity on which the Oversoul is modeled--the mysterious Keeper of the Earth.
    
    http://us.macmillan.com/series/HomecomingSaga

series.title: Ender's Shadow
series.description: This series is a companion-series to The Ender Quintet told from the perspective of other key characters. Ender's Shadow takes place consecutively with Ender's Game. Shadow of the Hegemon, Shadow Puppets, and Shadow of the Giant all take place consecutively with Ender in Exile. Shadows in Flight takes place consecutively with Speaker for the Dead, Xenocide, and Children of the Mind. Shadows Alive takes place after the Ender Quintet series. http://us.macmillan.com/series/TheShadowSeries
series.note: Added links to the Ender Quintet "The Shadow Series" is the series as listed in Amazon. However, Ender's Shadow is the most common series title listed on most websites. Either way, "Shadow Saga" was incorrect. Another librarian had stated that "Series" should not be in series title due to goodreads title convention, but the librarian manual does not state this. However, with this in mind, and because it is a part of the Ender World, I have updated the series to the most commonly recognized "Ender's Shadow".

series.title: Enderverse:  Publication Order
series.description: This series listing gives the Ender books in publication order. For the books in chronological order, see The Ender Quintet (which will also give more complete information about the series) and The Shadow Series. series.note: The Ender Quintet is the official series title. I updated the title accordingly. Ender's Saga is a popular term but is not accurate. The Shadow Series is official where Shadow Saga is not... someone else had mentioned that "Series" should not be in series title due to goodreads rules, but the librarian manual does not state this. However, with this in mind, the series most commonly recognized across the web is "Ender's Shadow" series. So it was updated accordingly.
